clinical_study.brief_title: Dose-finding Trial of HCD122 in Patients With Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia (CLL) That is Relapsed or Non-responsive to Prior Fludaribine Therapy
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label,Multi-center, Phase l/ll Study of Anti-CD40 Monoclonal Antibody (HCD122) Administered Intravenously to Subjects With Advanced Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia That is Refractory or Relapsed After at Least One Previous Fludarabine-containing Chemotherapy Regimen

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to determine the highest tolerated dose, safety and activity of HCD122 in patients with chronic lymphocytic leukemia who are relapsed after receiving prior treatment.

clinical_study.why_stopped: Slow enrollment and minimal preliminary biological and clinical efficacy.

primary_outcome.measure: to determine the maximum tolerated dose (MTD)
primary_outcome.time_frame: between study Day 1 and study Day 50

secondary_outcome.measure: to characterize safety and tolerability of HCD122 at each dose level in dose escalation patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: between study Day 1 and study termination

secondary_outcome.measure: To characterize pharmacokinetics of HCD122 at each dose level in dose escalation patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: between study Day 1 and study termination

secondary_outcome.measure: To characterize peripheral blood CD40 occupancy on CD5/CD19 (CLL) cells and CD5/CD19 cell depletion activity (pharmacodynamics) of HCD122 at each dose level in dose escalation patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: between study Day 1 and study termination

secondary_outcome.measure: To assess preliminary anti-tumor activity of HCD122 in dose escalation patients
secondary_outcome.time_frame: between study Day 1 and study termination

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Clinical diagnosis of CLL requiring treatment
- Refractory or relapsed disease
- Prior treatment with fludarabine
- Male or Female
- >18 years of age
Exclusion Criteria:
- Treatment with rituximab within 90 days and alemtuzumab or any monoclonal antibody within 6 months.
- Clinically significant cardiac dysfunction or other significant organ dysfunction
Additional eligibility criteria apply that will be reviewed with potential study subjects at the site.
